chargeHist.descr: 1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13
1st Degree Child Sex Assault - Sexual Contact with Person under Age of 13

result.execSummary:
The defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Intent. Contribute/Delinquency (Felony), a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 948.40(1).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

miscConds.notes:
- Court sets Restitution at $0(zero).
- Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
- Defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of probation or extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment. If confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.
- Court advises the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.

- No Contact Order with the victim or any member of the victim's family (exception:  defendant may have contact with his own mother).
- No unsupervised contact with any juvenile under the age of 16 years.

- Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.
- Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy.

timeConds.notes: Condition time is stayed for use by the agent.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather

records.addlTxt: Filed: Original Transcript of SENTENCING HEARING (39 pages) commencing 07-26-2022, by Robyn D. Harrell.
Notice of Right to Seek Postconviction Relief - received
Pretrial Incarceration Credit - received

Defense counsel requests expungement.
For reasons stated on the record, Court will not grant expungement as to this case

Sentencing proceeds.  State has complied with victim notification.  Statements by the State and defense counsel.  

-  Court sets Restitution at $0  (zero)

COURT ORDERS defendant to serve a term in the Wisconsin State Prison system - TOTAL LENGTH OF SENTENCE -  6  years; INITIAL TERM OF CONFINEMENT -  3  years; EXTENDED SUPERVISION -  3  years.  
COURT STAYS the sentence and places the defendant on probation for a period of  3  years.

Court finds defendant is NOT eligible for the Challenge Incarceration Program and is NOT eligible for the Substance Abuse Program.

CONDITIONS OF PROBATION:
-  Serve 6 months in the House of Correction.  Condition time is stayed for use by the agent.
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  No Contact Order with the victim or any member of the victim's family (exception:  defendant may have contact with his own mother)
-  No unsupervised contact with any juvenile under the age of 16 years
-  Seek/Maintain employment or continuing education
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of probation. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

CONDITIONS OF EXTENDED SUPERVISION:
-  Mental Health evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  Sex Offender evaluation and comply with any recommended treatment and/or therapy
-  No Contact Order with the victim or any member of the victim's family (exception:  defendant may have contact with his own mother)
-  No unsupervised contact with any juvenile under the age of 16 years
-  Seek/Maintain employment or continuing education
-  Pay the costs, fees, assessments and surcharges during the term of extended supervision.  Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.

COURT ORDERS:
-  defendant to provide a biological specimen for DNA analysis and pay the surcharge (if not already done so) during the term of probation or extended supervision. Failure to pay will result in a civil judgment.
if confinement is served - DOC to collect monetary sums/amounts at a rate (to be determined by DOC) of prison funds.

Appeal rights given.

Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  All parties appear in person.
Defendant has a pending case in Branch 1; Court will hear Case# 22CM00903 on today's date with this case.

State has filed an Amended Information.
Defendant is prepared to enter a plea.

As to the amended Count:
Defendant advised of constitutional rights and maximum penalties; waives constitutional rights, enters a plea of  GUILTY  and is examined as to the plea.  Plea Questionnaire/Waiver of Rights and Addendum received and filed.  Parties stipulate to the Complaint as a factual basis for judgment.  Court finds defendant guilty as charged in the Amended Information/Complaint and orders a judgment of conviction be entered.

COURT ADVISES the defendant he cannot possess firearms; further, defendant is advised he cannot vote until his civil rights are restored.  Defendant was further advised that if not a United States citizen deportation is possible. 

Parties are prepared to proceed to sentencing.

Clerk:  jms

State has filed an Amended Information:

Count 1:   INTENT. CONTRIBUTE TO THE DELINQUENCY OF A CHILD - FELONY, a class H felony, contrary to sec. 948.40(1) and (4)(b), 939.50(3)(h) Wis. Stats.
Jury Instruction - filed with plea questionnaire
Ineligible Voting Notice and Acknowledgement - received
Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for July 26, 2022 at 09:00 am.

Court sets bail at $7,500 cash

Turnover to JusticePoint for Level 5 supervision and GPS monitoring

Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris in court, defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather not in court, in custody.  Alicia H Kort appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Both parties appear in person.
Defense counsel is requesting bail hearing on today's date.
State advises Court that victim has not been notified.
Court finds that a written bail motion was filed approximately one month ago which is sufficient time for victim notification.
Court will hear bail arguments

Bail motion by defense argued and partially granted by the Court. 

Defense counsel requests adjournment for plea and sentencing.
Court orders case adjourned for plea and sentencing in Branch 28.

records.addlTxt: Proposed Order Regarding Defense's Use of Videotaped Statements - Whitefeather, Eddie Gabriel.docx, Filed.
Stipulation Signed by the Parties.pdf, Filed.
Defense Motion for Reduction of Bail Received and Filed.
Request for Substitution

Request for Substitution of Judge received and filed.  Court consented to substitution against Judge Watts.  Parties are advised the Clerk of Circuit Court reassigned case pursuant to current court rules to Judge Rothstein, Br. 25.

Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in court with attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris.  Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in custody.  Adam Joseph Best appeared for the State of Wisconsin. PARTIES APPEAR BY VIDEO. Preliminary hearing proceeded.  Sworn for the State: MPD Detective Z.Thoms.   State rests.  Defense rests.  Defense motion to dismiss argued and denied. Court found probable cause and bound defendant over for trial.  Original information received and filed;  defendant given a copy, waived reading, was arraigned in open court and plead not guilty.  Case is adjourned to Branch 28.  Scheduling conference scheduled for June 17, 2022 at 08:30 am.

03:43 PM Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in court with Attorney Thomas Evangelos Harris; both appear by video.  Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in custody.  Abby Rockendorf appeared in person for the State of Wisconsin.
Case set for a preliminary hearing. States witness is unavailable; in training. Defense moves to dismiss. Defense to be heard on bail on the next date. Court ordered case adjourned for CAUSE for a Preliminary Hearing in Preliminary Hearing Court, Room 146 of the Criminal Justice Facility.  Preliminary hearing scheduled for May 13, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Signed and filed, No Contact Order.  Defendant to have no contact with A.I.R. (DOB 11/02/2010); Kerwin R.-M.; Deborah C.: Alnelia I.R.

Court ordered defendant TURNED OVER TO Justice Point for Level 5 Supervision with Electronic Monitoring; no contact order.  If electronic monitoring device is unavailable and cash bail has been paid, Defendant to be released and placed on the waiting list.  No possession of dangerous weapons or firearms.

Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in court with attorney Vincent Paul Guimont.  Defendant Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather in custody.  Karine O'Byrne appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Eddie Gabriel Whitefeather appeared by video means with Attorney.  Due to 21CF1912, the defendant is advised that case is reassigned to Judge Watts, Branch 15.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  Commissioner advised DNA sample has been obtained from the Defendant.  Court advised Defendant he may qualify to have the DNA sample data expunged if he meets the conditions under Wisconsin Statutes Section 165.77(4).
